_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Closed circuit video, Operator visual inspections
_prev_prog_3.Description: The covered process is Program Level 3. The PSM program for the Mosaic Kentucky Facility includes the required procedures and information in case of emergency situations. The PSM plan includes safety and site specific information to protect human health, including chain of command and appropriate contacts.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Mosaic Crop Nutrition, LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Mosaic Company, owns and operates the Mosaic Henderson KY Terminal.  The Mosaic Crop Nutrition distribution facility, handles anhydrous ammonia, which is considered hazardous by EPA.  The same properties that make anhydrous ammonia valuable as a commodity also make it necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling anhydrous ammonia to prevent unnecessary human exposure, to reduce the threat to our employees and nearby community.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal and state rules and regulations, and we are committed to conducting business and operating our facilities in a manner designed to protect the environment, as well as the health and safety of our employees and surrounding community.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substance:

The Mosaic Henderson KY Terminal receives, stores, and distributes anhydrous ammonia.  The anhydrous ammonia that the Terminal receives is unloaded from river barges at the dock and transferred via an above ground pipeline to two interconnected above-ground low-pressure storage tanks.  The ammonia is later transferred from the terminal's low pressure storage tanks to one of 12 truck unloading stations, so that it can then be transported to the terminal's downstream customers.  Anhydrous ammonia is classified as a regulated toxic substance by the EPA.  The Mosaic Henderson KY Terminal does not maintain any other chemicals, besides anhydrous ammonia, that are classified as a regulated toxic and/or flammable material by the EPA in quantities above those listed in Tables 1, 2, 3, and 4 in section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act. 



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Polices:

The Mosaic Henderson KY Terminal has an extensive safety program to ensure compliance with all applicable local, state and federal rules and regulations. The facility operates under a Corporate Environmental Health and Safety Policy that end

story: 

The facility has not had any accidental releases within the past 5 years that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



Emergency Response Program:

The Terminal is a non-responding facility.  The terminal's employees have been trained on the terminal's emergency action plan, as required by 29 CFR 1910.38.  However, the terminal's employees are not authorized to respond to an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. 



Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

The Mosaic Henderson KY Terminal is committed to implementing, reviewing, and updating its PSM and RMP programs to ensure the continued safe operation of the terminal's covered anhydrous ammonia process.  In addition, the Mosaic Henderson, KY Terminal plans to continue to provide support to, and work with, the local emergency planning committee and emergency response agencies to plan and/or drill for a potential emergency at the terminal.
